action.action-desc: Ms. Hassan (for herself and Mr. Cornyn) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs

form.official-title: To amend the Fair Credit Reporting Act to address the placement of security freezes for protected consumers, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Credit Freeze for Kids Act.

subsection.text: Section 605A(j)(2)(A) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act (15 U.S.C. 1681c–1(j)(2)(A)) is amended to read as follows:

subparagraph.text: Upon receiving a direct request from a protected consumer’s representative that a consumer reporting agency place a security freeze, which shall include sufficient proof of identification, sufficient proof of authority, and all other necessary documentation, the following shall apply:

clause.text: The consumer reporting agency shall, free of charge—

subclause.text: in the case of a request that is by toll-free telephone, secure electronic means, or mail, place the security freeze not later than 3 business days after receiving the request directly from the protected consumer’s representative; and
not later than 3 business days after receiving the request directly from the protected consumer’s representative, notify each other consumer reporting agency regarding the request.

clause.text: A consumer reporting agency receiving a notification submitted under clause (i)(II) shall place the requested freeze not later than 3 business days after receiving that notification.

subsection.text: The amendments made by subsection (a) shall take effect on the date that is 18 months after the date of enactment of this Act.
